result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas N. Matke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*If probation revoked - huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
*Serve second half on the electronic home monitor if approved by jail and risk assessment

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
*Cash bond of $150 to be applied to costs.
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

*If probation is sucessfully completed may be allowed early discharge if approved by the agent 
*Obtain prescriptions from one pharmacy 
*Sign all releases so agent can monitor the prescription medications
*Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places: Sylvia Worzalla without agent approval 
*Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent; if domestic abuse program recommended needs to comply.
*Provide DNA Sample 
*Write letter of apology to Sylvia Worzalla within the next 30 days and provide to agent to forward to the victim.
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Portage County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Thomas N. Matke in court with attorney Melissa Hope Dalkert. Atty Louis Molepske appearing for Elizabeth R. Constable on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CM471 and 15CM530.

8:40 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Atty Molepske indicates victim notification had been complied with and no victim's appear in Court today.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM471:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - No contest 

15CM530:
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 2 of 15CM471 and Count 1 is DRI and guilty on Count 1 & 2 of 15CM530.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Dalkert makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CM471:
Count 1 - DRI

Count 2 -
Impose/Stay jail sentence of 6 months
**Placed on Probation for a period of 24 months:
If probation revoked huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the Sheriff will allow.
Serve second half on the electronic home monitor if approved by jail and risk assessment
*1 day jail credit
Conditions of Probation:
*Pay costs - including DNA Surcharge and Domestic Abuse Surcharge
*If probation is successfully completed may be allowed early discharge if approved by the agent
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Obtain prescriptions from one pharmacy
*Sign all releases so agent can monitor the prescription medications 
*Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:   Sylvia Worzella without agent approval
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
*Participate in any counseling and assessments recommended by the agent; if domestic abuse program recommended needs to comply.
*Provide DNA Sample
*Write letter of apology to Sylvia Worzella within next 30 days and provide to agent to forward to victim
*Cash bond of $150 to be applied to costs

15CM530:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay jail sentence of 3 months - concurrent to 15CM471
If probation revoked huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the Sheriff will allow.
**Placed on Probation for a period of 24 months:
*1 day jail credit (this credit is for both counts 1 & 2)
Conditions of Probation:
*Comply with conditions in 15CM471
*Pay costs - DNA Surcharge

Count 2 - 
Impose/Stay jail sentence of 30 days - concurrent to Count 1 and 15CM471
If probation revoked huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the Sheriff will allow.
**Placed on Probation for a period of 24 months:
Conditions of Probation:
*Comply with conditions in 15CM471
*Pay costs - No DNA Surcharge
